testcase.purpose: This test verifies combinations of valid, active attribute types cannot be bound to the same location with bindAttribLocation
This test verifies that vectors placed via bindAttribLocation right after matricies will fail if there is insufficient room for the matrix
tests that turning on attribs that have no buffer bound fails to draw
This tests ensures that matrix attribute locations do not clash with other shader attributes
This test ensures WebGL implementations vertexAttrib can be set and read
This test checks vertexAttribPointer behaviors in WebGL
Verify that using constant attributes works
Test some of the issues of the difference between attrib 0 on OpenGL vs WebGL
Checks a buffer can only be bound to 1 target
Test ARRAY_BUFFER deletion when a vertex attrib array with location != 0 is pointing to it and preserveDrawingBuffer is true
Element Array Buffer Deletion and Recreation Test
Test that client data is always copied during bufferData and bufferSubData calls, because otherwise the data the GL uses to draw may differ from that checked by the index validation code
Verifies that the index validation code which is within bufferSubData does not crash
Tests that index validation for drawElements works with large attribute buffers
Tests that index validation for drawElements does not examine too many indices
Test that updating the size of a vertex buffer is properly noticed by the WebGL implementation
Tests that index validation verifies the correct number of indices

Verifies that rapidly resizing the canvas works correctly

This test ensures that the WebGL context has all the constants and (non-function) properties in the specification
Verify that preserveDrawingBuffer attribute is honored
Verify WebGLContextAttributes are working as specified, including alpha, depth, stencil, antialias, but not premultipliedAlpha

Test that you can create large numbers of WebGL contexts
Test that context eviction and garbage collection do not interfere with each other

This test ensures that WebGL contexts are released properly when a worker is used
Tests behavior under a restored context
Tests behavior under a lost context
This test ensures WebGL implementations interact correctly with the canvas tag
Tests calling WebGL APIs with objects from other contexts

Test the WebGL premultipliedAlpha context creation flag

This test verifies that unary operators +, ++, -, --, !, and ~ do not work on structures. Per the spec, field selectors, equality and assignment are the only operators allowed on structures
